# Syllabus Policies

## Class Structure

- Flipped classroom
- You prepare for class on your own
- We'll do a (very short) review at the start of class
- Most of class will be working on the homework

- I can help you get through the frustrating bits more quickly!

## Grades

Assignments | Weight
----- | -----
Reading Quizzes | 10%
Attendance & Participation | 10%
Weekly Homeworks | 40% 
Midterm Exam | 20%
Final Exam | 20%

## Reading Quizzes

- Due before class starts
- Will become inaccessible at 1pm on Wednesdays
- Open-book, open-note
- A deadline to encourage you to do the reading before class

## Participation/Attendance

- I will take attendance
- You get one free, no excuses necessary absence
- If you're sick, don't come to class!
  - Do the reading/homework, 
  - Make an appointment as you feel better
  - In the appointment field, indicate that this is to substitute for class attendance
  - Don't abuse this
  
## Homework

- Almost every week
- Homework can be resubmitted once for a re-grade
- Resubmissions are due on the Monday before the exam 
  - March 10 (midterm) 
  - May 5 (final)     
  (I can't make things due during finals week)

## Exams

- In-class exam (March 12) and Final (May 15, 1-3pm)

- Don't miss the exams!

- If you miss the midterm AND notify me beforehand AND have a valid excuse...    
the final is worth 40%

- If you miss the final AND notify me beforehand AND have a valid excuse...    
Incomplete + make up final w/ an oral exam component

## Oral Exam Policy

- You must understand any code you turn in

- If you can't explain it to me and answer my questions, you don't get credit

- I will send an oral exam request via canvas/email

- You must schedule an appt within 24h (appt within 3 business days)

- I'll ask you questions about your submission

## Class Environment

- Programming = making silly mistakes

- The easiest mistakes to fix are typos! Don't be embarrassed about them!

- New errors = new things to learn!
